Text.Value: Ah, well. If you had, I could not fault you for lying - his kind have charm beyond our mortal means to resist.
But she thrives on suffering. Once she hears what awaits my quarry when I catch him, she will help.

EditorData.NodeContext: Growing grave

Text.Value: I can handle it.
It's my pleasure. Really.
Of course - as the spider invites the fly. You need something, I expect. And she sensed it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not mocking, just gently brushing away the notion that we're in control of our situation

Text.Value: You're wise to walk away. But I cannot - the thing I hunt has gone to ground.

EditorData.NodeContext: Acknowledging that we have more willpower than him - he knows he shouldn't deal with a hag, but also knows he has to

Text.Value: Truly? Then you know what she is - what she can do.

EditorData.NodeContext: Surprised and impressed

Text.Value: I do not think that I will.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not angry, but utterly unintimidated by us

Text.Value: Leave.
Today? The same as you - a humble supplicant, come to bargain with the lady of this house.
I bid you fair fortune on the road. Though you seem the type to make your own.
Know how to ask, and they'll share that knowledge. If you're fool enough to pay their price.

EditorData.NodeContext: Telling us the risk might be worth the reward - but is is a great risk

Text.Value: She made me an offer - but I refused.
Baldur's Gate. My people wait for me there.
A just choice.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Standing over the unconcious body of Astarion.

Text.Value: So I learned.
And if I did?
What's it to you?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter knocks Astarion out while he's still focused on the player. The vampire collapses to the ground.
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN] [GUS-182713] A punch hitting someone, and the sound of a body landing onto the ground.

Text.Value: So instead: know you're outmatched. Know what you're willing to give. And mind your manners.
A more innocent name than some I could call her. But it is what she is that ought to concern you.
Who is it you're hunting?
Maybe I can help with your hunt.
But I'm not wrong. Take her lightly, and she'll serve up your eyes for appetisers.
I'll eat them, too. I need her knowledge - the thing I hunt has gone to ground.

EditorData.NodeContext: Only faintly apologetic - he wishes us no harm, but he needs the hag and her information

Text.Value: You would be wise to look past the seeming of things, if you intend to bargain with the lady of this house.
We share a profession, it seems. I'm Wyll - better known as the Blade of Frontiers.
Your coyness is getting boring. Tell me.
Selne's light go with you. I fear you will need it to face what is coming.

EditorData.NodeContext: Genuinely wishing us well with a tough trial ahead - ominous warning. (Seh-LOON-ay)

Text.Value: There's enough deception in this place - don't add to it.
A wise decision. I will do my work - and for what it is worth, I will take no pleasure in it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Comforting us after we've given up our friend, and assuring us there'll be no suffering.

Text.Value: I would not be so sure. But I won't keep the truth from you.
Ah - so you did. I thought you were just squinting from the stink.

EditorData.NodeContext: Getting a better look at one of your eyes, which is glowing with a baleful light after you traded it to a hag.

Text.Value: If captured, my people will make him talk. So I ask again: is he known to you?
Strong words may frighten others, my friend, but it takes much more to scare those in my line of work.
It's amazing you survived, travelling with a beast like that.
I thank you for your help. My people work to rid this world of evil - you are a friend to our cause.
You're wasting your time. Astarion's been dealt with.
So you have met him. His kind have charm beyond our mortal means to resist.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confirming his suspicions that we know the man he seeks

Text.Value: There, I'm afraid you're wrong.

EditorData.NodeContext: This line leads to combat.

Text.Value: They'll stop plotting to kill one another just long enough to focus all that energy on you, instead.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wryly amused at the pettiness of powerful beings

Text.Value: Speak plainly. What is she?
So said the fish 'round the hook in its mouth.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wry

Text.Value: You've done your part in dealing with the hag. Now, my own hunt must continue.
It isn't possible.
But best to take one terror at a time, hm? I've used enough of your time - the lady awaits.
But you're right - he's no true vampire. Not yet. I don't suppose you'll tell me where he is?
I did - but I let her keep her life.
I like danger. The truth - now.
I'd advise against helping such a creature thrive. What quarry could be worth that price?
If she can tell me how to flush him out, I'll pay whatever price she asks.

EditorData.logicalname: HAVE MET, HAVEN'T ASKED ABOUT ASTARION

Text.Value: I'll return him to my tribe, as ordered. Whatever fate awaits him there, I'm sure it is deserved.
Not at all. I was invited for tea.
And are you fool enough?
Whatever's easiest to lose and hardest to do without.
Any advice on how to deal with her?
You're a monster hunter? Not what I imagined.
I can show you who he truly is - if you will just tell me where to find him.
Or just as easily find it pressed against our throat. I would not put you in danger.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grave - we're asking a question he believes we don't really want the answer to. The warning is for our own good, not a threat

Text.Value: The thing I hunt has eluded me too long. The hag can have what she wants, so long as she helps me find him first.
Are you talking about Auntie Ethel?
I suggest you find yours before dealing with the lady of this house.

EditorData.NodeContext: Advising with only a slight hint of admonishment

Text.Value: You made a fine kill today, my friend - content yourself with that.

EditorData.NodeContext: This is a threat, but given in the guise of friendly advice. He thinks we'd be wiser not to push any further.

Text.Value: Tell him how to find your camp.
Come now - I've almost certainly killed worse.
...As you say. Then I must redouble my efforts, and pray my delay costs no more lives.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not fully believing us, but not pressing the issue.

Text.Value: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*
No. This duty is mine alone. But for such an offer, an answer at least is owed.
I honestly don't know where he is.
I have. She didn't survive the encounter.
A kind offer - but to accept it would be no kindness at all, I assure you.
I prefer a weapon to a stench, thanks.
You treacherous little worm!
Perhaps you could tell me where to look, and I could ensure peace of mind for us both?
Whatever you're hunting, your stench alone will kill it.
I'd like to trade.
May your road be kind.
Powdered iron-vine. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Explaining the smell in the air - he's taken a foul substance designed to ward off monsters

Text.Value: You can give up your hunt. Astarion's under my protection.
We've met - he's not the type to come quietly.
I hope this Ethel is waiting for you when you walk through that door. But I suspect you'll find something else.

EditorData.NodeContext: Earnest, but knows things are not as we wish them to be

Text.Value: My people were recently attacked in the night - our camp set upon by a band of vampire spawn.
Leave.
Her kind have hidden among us since the first darkness - and their knowledge is matched only by their spite.

EditorData.NodeContext: Growing slightly grave - telling us of a great evil thing that is not to be underestimated

Text.Value: We believe this Astarion knows exactly what happened that night, and where to find our little ones.
Go ahead. The lady of the house awaits.

EditorData.logicalname: MET BEFORE HAG - WE HAVE YET TO GO IN.

Text.Value: Perhaps I was... hasty with my words.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unnerved

Text.Value: A gentle name. But I speak of her nature.
The thing you hunt - it's my companion, Astarion. I didn't know what he was.
Thank you for this. And for cleansing this swamp of the hag. You have done good here today. Safe travels.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Gandrel speaks to Player while still carrying Astarion, and then walks away with Astarion on his shoulder
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.
EditorData.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

Text.Value: That is why you come to her lair, I take it? To bargain?

EditorData.NodeContext: Gently prodding for our story

Text.Value: I've never heard of him.
I hunt a vampire spawn called Astarion. I'm bound to bring him back to Baldur's Gate - alive.
Who are you?
I've delivered a monster to a monster hunter.
Honourable, but unwise. Her kind don't share your forgiving nature.

EditorData.NodeContext: Impress, but warning us

Text.Value: Of course. I'm a hunter who lost his prey, and here I am seeking help from something worse.

EditorData.NodeContext: Amused and absolutely accepting of his own foolishness

Text.Value: Astarion's the monster you seek. I wanted to protect him before.
Little enough - I hoped she might help me on my hunt, but I suppose she's... indisposed.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unfazed by our hostility to his questions - explaning that he was hoping to speak to someone he suspects we've just killed.

Text.Value: Courage has played its part in this story, my friend. Caution will see you live to tell it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Accepting our tough talk, but advising that we might be biting off more than we can chew

Text.Value: I know Astarion - he's no vampire.
Leave.
I'll have to find my quarry by more traditional means. But, one hunter to another - well done.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resolving himself to taking the harder road, but never despairing - the congratulating you on your kill

Text.Value: Though... perhaps I speak too swiftly. You have an odour of your own.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stopping, sniffing the air, look at us more closely

Text.Value: You do know him? I don't suppose you'll tell me where he is?
Truth is like a blade, my friend. We can arm ourselves with it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grave - we're asking a question he believes we don't really want the answer to

Text.Value: What price is that?
For my part - I need her knowledge. The thing I hunt has gone to ground.
You take insult where none is intended, my friend. But fine - I won't add to it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mild, amused but unfazed by our aggression - but giving us our way

Text.Value: I'd like to trade.
Sharp steel is not proof against all the monsters of this world, my friend.
A sharp wit will serve you better, if you're to bargain with the lady of this house.
You know him? Not too well, I think, if you believe he is so easily slain. He could be stalking your camp at this very moment.
Speak for yourself - I got what I wanted.
Not much of a bargain. She made an offer - I refused.
Questions should never bring you regret, my friend. Answers are another matter.

EditorData.NodeContext: Softening the blow of his refusal to answer our questions

Text.Value: Who is it you're hunting?
As you like. But you needn't be coy - whatever's worth knowing, rest assured she already knows it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nodding, not fazed by our secrecy though he thinks it unnecessary

Text.Value: Price? She was lucky to keep her life.
Leave.
Never mind. I already regret asking.
A charming sight, to be sure. But the prettiest web still has a spider sitting at its centre.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of sign for tea-house here if possible.

Text.Value: What?!

EditorData.NodeContext: Outraged

Text.Value: Oh? And bring him where, exactly?
Leave.
Or so I'm told. With the hag gone, I shall have to wait a while longer to see for myself.
Relax, he's not taking you anywhere.
Truly? I won't mourn her passing, though I hoped she would help me on my hunt.

EditorData.NodeContext: Faintly surprised - glad to hear this, though it sets his plans back a bit

Text.Value: Your wisdom does you credit. Mine, I'm afraid, is outweighed by need.
It's yours. This is the only prize I need.
Not this time. My orders are to capture him.
An old hunter's trick - if you can't mask your scent, spoil it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Friendly, unassuming, as if what he's saying is perfectly conventional

Text.Value: What'll you do when you find the vampire? Kill him?
Scream. Turn. Run the other way - that's what I'd like to say.
Without doubt. But this is a personal quarry - one hunter to another, I'm sure you understand.
Hah! A quick wit is rare indeed. Good manners, however, all beings can aspire to.

EditorData.NodeContext: We've just insulted him and he's absolutely unfazed. Second line is simply polite advice.

Text.Value: Questions are free - answers are not. Better to learn that before you meet the lady of the house.

EditorData.NodeContext: Deflecting

Text.Value: The only price paid was hers. She's dead.
The stench of fey blood. You've already met the hag, then?

EditorData.NodeContext: Deducing

Text.Value: I can wait. You, on the other hand, should already be running. Her coven will hear of this.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gentle warning

Text.Value: I think you're mistaken - this place looks innocent enough.
Besides - first I must survive what waits in that house. One terror at a time, hm?

EditorData.NodeContext: Terrified of ethel but holding it together

Text.Value: I bid you good fortune with the lady of the house.
You idiot. What have you done?

EditorData.NodeContext: Furious

Text.Value: Because this is her domain. If you are here, it is because it suits her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stating the facts as they are - the hag dwarfs his power, and he accepts that and walks in anyway

Text.Value: Why would you assume that?
I won't pry - not when I have need of her myself.
You've tracked me down again, my friend. Would that I had as much luck with the beast I'm hunting.
I'm not going to help you find him. Back off.
Moonmaiden's light upon you. And may she spare a little for me, too.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bracing himself for a task he's not looking forward to - he's about to go in and bargain with a fey creature. More apprehension and reluctant necessity than fear.
EditorData.logicalname: MET BEFORE + AFTER HAG, GOT ALL BEATS.

Text.Value: I'm here to help. This is Astarion - the vampire you're hunting.
What?

EditorData.NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun.

Text.Value: It's a teahouse - hardly a lair.
Your name should serve you well when you meet with the lady of this house.
It is not everyone who can see past her parlour tricks. As you wish - the truth is not mine to keep.

EditorData.NodeContext: Impressed at how perceptive we are

Text.Value: Hah. Perhaps that is why I have survived so long where more fearsome peers have not.

EditorData.NodeContext: Serene, absolutely unoffended by us basically saying he doesn't look too tough

Text.Value: But the thing I hunt has gone to ground. If she can tell me how to draw him out, I'll pay whatever she asks.
Take the spawn, just leave his stuff with me.
What does your tribe want with a creature like that?

EditorData.logicalname: HAVE MET, HAVEN'T ASKED ABOUT ASTARION

Text.Value: You met with this Auntie Ethel, I take it. But did you pay her price?

EditorData.NodeContext: Straight to the point

Text.Value: My business here is my own.
If you'll forgive me, my friend - you have the stink of fey about you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sniffing and commenting on the smell, at pains not to be impolite
EditorData.logicalname: MET BEFORE HAG, HAVEN'T SPOKEN TO SINCE HAG

Text.Value: I have a cage ready nearby - it will hold him when he wakes.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Gandrel crouches down, picks up an unconscious Astarion, and slings him over his shoulder.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Hunter pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over his shoulder.
EditorData.NodeContext: Leans down to pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over your shoulder.
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN] [GUS-182713] Sound of someone getting lifted up and hoisted onto shoulder

Text.Value: Astarion has quite the friend in you. I'll make sure he knows that, at the end.

EditorData.NodeContext: Seeing through our intimidation, but respecting our intentions - and a little sad at what he has to do. (NOTE - he doesn't attack us, but is reaffirming that he will find Astarion one way or another)

Text.Value: I would have made a deal with the hag to find this. I'm very glad that I did not. Thank you and safe travels.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Gandrel speaks to Player while still carrying Astarion, and then walks away with Astarion on his shoulder
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.
EditorData.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

Text.Value: In the chaos of battle, one of them stole away with our children. We have been searching for them ever since.
'The lady of this house'?
But bad as she is, I'm betting whatever drove you to her door is worse.
...I see. Your loyalty is admirable but misplaced. His kind have charm beyond our mortal means to resist.

EditorData.NodeContext: Digesting this information, taking us seriously

Text.Value: But, one fool to another, I can't say I judge you. The thing I hunt has slipped away from me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shrugging - he can't judge us for a foolish decision when he's here to make the same mistake

Text.Value: I know Ethel - that sounds nothing like her.
Though I cannot swear to his condition once my tribe are done with him. Is he known to you?
What will happen to him?
I hoped she might help me on my hunt - but I have no desire to be the first face she sees after yours.

EditorData.NodeContext: Knows what's good for him

Text.Value: Ah, a fellow wanderer. Forgive the aroma.

EditorData.NodeContext: Friendly - noticing a stranger, wryly apologising for the slight stench

Text.Value: A powerful friend. A terrible foe. That, I cannot decide for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stating simply

Text.Value: Ah, the Blade of Frontiers! You wield that reputation as deftly as a blade itself.

EditorData.NodeContext: Warm

Text.Value: Attack.
That would be nice. I'd welcome a proper cup of tea.

Synopsis:
Male, middle-age or older.
Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion). A younger General Iroh from Avatar is a good reference - someone who makes you feel good about yourself just by conversing with you.
